programme.title: OT1000 United Premier League Goals
programme.desc: 92/93 & 93/94. We go back to the start of the first two seasons of the Premier League and take a look at the first 78 goals scored as United recorded back-to-back league titles

programme.title: OT1000 United Premier League Goals
programme.desc: 94/95 & 95/96. Volume 2 takes us from goal 79 to goal 156, including the record 9-0 win over Ipswich and United's fastest Premier League goal, scored by Ryan Giggs

programme.title: OT1000 United Premier League Goals
programme.desc: 96/97 & 97/98. Volume 3 takes us from goal 157 to goal 236, including Eric Cantona's famous chip against Sunderland and another league title for the Reds

programme.title: OT1000 United Premier League Goals
programme.desc: 98/99 & 99/00. Volume 4 takes us from goal 237 to goal 340. The Reds recorded a historic Treble and then went goal crazy, hitting 59 to win the league in 1999/2000

programme.title: Thursday Focus
programme.desc: A special guest joins David May to discuss the latest United news

programme.title: OT1000 United Premier League Goals
programme.desc: 00/01 & 01/02. Volume 5 takes us from goal 341 to goal 429, including six of the best in one memorable afternoon against Arsenal

programme.title: OT1000 United Premier League Goals
programme.desc: 02/03 & 03/04. Volume 6 takes us from goal 430 to goal 508. The Reds' faithful were treated to the finishing prowess of Ruud van Nistelrooy, who scored three hat-tricks in 02/03

programme.title: OT1000 United Premier League Goals
programme.desc: 04/05 & 05/06. Volume 7 takes us from goal 509 to goal 576, including Wayne Rooney's majestic volley against Newcastle as he announced himself as the next United superstar

programme.title: OT1000 United Premier League Goals
programme.desc: 06/07 & 07/08. Volume 8 takes us from goal 577 to goal 669, as the Reds reclaimed their Premier League crown and Cristiano Ronaldo scored goal after goal, including 21 in a season

programme.title: OT1000 United Premier League Goals
programme.desc: 10/11 & 11/12. Volume 10 takes us from goal 765 to goal 865, including a memorable derby goal from Wayne Rooney and a remarkable afternoon against Arsenal, as the Reds hit eight

Evroliga - 30. Round: CSKA Moskva - Olympiacos
programme.desc: Evroliga je najkvalitetnejše in najbolje organizirano klubsko košarkarsko tekmovanje na stari celini, ki je pred letošnjo sezono doživelo kar nekaj sprememb, a kljub temu se nam obeta nova sezona izjemnih košarkarskih užitkov. Najuspešnejši klub je madridski Real. Aktualni prvaki so košarkarji CSKA-ja iz Moskve

programme.title: Spanish league: Villarreal - Athletic Bilbao
programme.desc: Španska nogometna liga, bolj poznana pod vzdevkom La Liga, je najelitnejše nogometno tekmovanje v Španiji. Ustanovljena je bila leta 1929. V ligi nastopa 20 klubov, kjer vsako sezono nekdo postane prvak in izpade v špansko drugo ligo. Najuspešnejša kluba sta madridski Real in Barcelona. Skupaj sta ligo osvojila kar 55 krat. Zadnji naslov je romal v roke Barcelone

programme.desc: Evroliga je najkvalitetnejše in najbolje organizirano klubsko košarkarsko tekmovanje na stari celini, ki je pred letošnjo sezono doživelo kar nekaj sprememb, a kljub temu se nam obeta nova sezona izjemnih košarkarskih užitkov. programme.desc: Po letih vladavine Seville bomo letos dobili novega zmagovalca v Evropski ligi. Kdo bo Andaluzijce nasledil na prestolu? Vse zanimivosti o drugem najelitnejšem evropskem klubskem tekmovanju izveste v magazinu

programme.title: Evroliga - 30. Round: Darussafaka - Crvena zvezda
programme.desc: Crvena zvezda si je napredovanje v izločilne boje poskušala zagotoviti že pred zadnjim krogom, toda usoda je hotela, da bo o tem odločala v zadnjem krogu na medsebojnem obračunu proti Darušafaki. Medtem ko bo zmagovalec pobral vse, kot radi rečemo, bodo poraženci še nekaj časa obžalovali zapravljeno priložnost

programme.title: UEFA Champions League: Magazin
programme.desc: Branilec naslova najmočnejšega klubskega nogometnega tekmovanja v Evropi je madridski Real, ki se je prek Atletica dokopal že do enajstega evropskega naslova. programme.title: Premier league: Prediction circle
programme.desc: Oglejte si vse zanimivosti pred novim krogom Premier lige

programme.title: Live! Premier league: Tottenham - Watford
programme.desc: Premier League je profesionalna nogometna liga v Angliji. V njej nastopa 20 klubov, ki se od avgusta do maja borijo za naslov prvaka. Večina tekem je odigranih ob sobotah in nedeljah popoldan, preostalih nekaj krogov pa med tednom zvečer. Premier League je najbolj gledana nogometna liga na svetu. Aktualni prvaki so nogometaši Leicestra

programme.title: Live! Spanish league: Real Madrid - Atletico Madrid
programme.desc: Atletico letos ni uspel resneje ogroziti Reala in Barcelone, colchonerosi se bodo morali pošteno potruditi celo za tretje mesto, saj Sevilla igra odlično in pridno nabira točke. Zmaga na mestnem madridskem derbiju bi Janu Oblaku in soigralcem zato prinesla še veliko več, kot le prestiž, toda jasno je, da vse ne bo odvisno le od njih. Ekipa Zinedina Zidana v zaključku sezone funkcionira vse bolje in v boju s Katalonci za prvi naslov po nekaj sušnih letih nujno potrebuje vse tri točke

programme.title: Live! Premier league: Bournemouth - Chelsea
programme.desc: Kdo še lahko ustavi Chelsea v pohodu na nov naslov angleških prvakov? Antonio Conte bo svojo ekipo tokrat odpeljal v Bournemouth, ki si je obstanek praktično že zagotovil in bo proti Londončanom lahko zaigral povsem neobremenjen

programme.title: Live! Spanish league: Malaga - Barcelona
programme.desc: Malaga je novembra na Camp Nou vzela točko, čeprav je srečanje končala z dvema izključenima igralcema, a je treba tudi dodati, da je Barcelona igrala brez Lionela Messija in Luisa Suareza. Argentinec in Urugvajec bosta tokrat zagotovo v kadru, saj si Katalonci v luči boja za naslov prvaka ne smejo privoščiti spodrsljaja. Lahko Malaga še enkrat preseneti aktualne španske prvake?

programme.title: Portugal liga: Feirense - Braga
programme.desc: Nekoč Primeira Liga, danes Liga NOS je najelitnejše nogometno tekmovanje na Portugalskem. V njej vsako leto sodeluje 18 klubov, vendar le pet je takšnih, ki so jo od leta 1934 (datum ustanovitve) tudi osvojili. Kar 81 od skupnih 83 naslovov je osvojila t.i. velika trojica (Benfica, Sporting in Porto) preostala dva naslova pa sta romala v roke Belenensesa in Boaviste. Aktualni prvaki so nogometaši Benfice

programme.title: The Masters: First-round play
programme.desc: The 81st edition of golf's opening major tees off at Augusta (Ga.) National GC. World No. 2 Rory McIlroy (top-10s last three years) can complete a career grand slam with a win. Notable first-time players include Jon Rahm, Alex Noren and Tyrrell Hatton. Danny Willett shot a first-round 70 en route to victory last year. (cc)

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: ESPN's flagship program provides a thorough presentation of sports news, highlights and analysis. The Emmy-winning show revolutionized the sports-news genre by deftly mixing information with irreverence in a hip, daily scrapbook of homers, touchdowns and slam dunks, the perfect clips-and-controversies fix for sports junkies. Staple features besides game scores and highlights include expert breakdowns, `Top Ten Plays', Web polls and trivia. (live) (cc)

programme.title: The Sports Reporters *
programme.desc: A changing panel of sports journalists discusses current stories in a series that launched in 1988, with Dick Schaap and John Saunders serving as hosts for all but the first and last year of a near three-decade run on Sunday mornings. programme.title: Tottenham Hotspur v Watford
programme.desc: Wednesday night's thrilling finish at Swansea keeps Tottenham in the title race, although Chelsea don't look like a team who are about to throw away a seven-point advantage at this stage of the season.Mauricio Pochettino's free-scoring side have won 12 of the last 15 games, while making only a small dent in Chelsea's lead, so just have to keep winning and hope for the best.Meanwhile, Watford have won their last two matches and have the same number of points as at this stage last season, but they haven't got a great record at White Hart Lane. It's 32 years since they last won there in the league(c)

programme.title: Football today
programme.desc: Brought to you By Renegades(c)

programme.title: AFC Bournemouth v Chelsea
programme.desc: A seven-point lead with eight games remaining is not a cast-iron guarantee of success, but it's hard to see the Blues straying from the blueprint which has taken them to the top.Don't forget that Antonio Conte won the championship with Juventus in each of his last three seasons as a club manager. The Italian knows his way around a run-in and will have delighted Chelsea by brushing aside rumours that he might decamp back to Serie A this summer.I was pretty concerned about Bournemouth a couple of months ago when it seemed they may be sucked into a relegation battle.Now that their defence is looking tighter - and Joshua King has embarked on a hot streak of nine goals in 10 games - improving on last season's 16th-place finish looks almost a certainty(c)

programme.title: Manchester City v Hull City
programme.desc: The targets for both clubs are crystal clear: Manchester City have to be playing Champions League football next season, while Hull are desperate to keep their place at the top table.After a testing run against Liverpool, Arsenal and Chelsea which yielded only two points, Manchester City have little room for error and this is a fixture they will hope to tick off without any drama.Hull, though, have renewed belief following a run of nine points from the last 12 to kick-start their survival campaign.Significantly, all those points have come at home and their solitary win on the road was back in August at Swansea.However, as Crystal Palace proved last weekend, at this stage of the season you should never say never(c)

programme.title: Middlesbrough v Burnley
programme.desc: After Wednesday's defeat at fellow strugglers Hull City, I thought this was a game Middlesbrough had to win.After checking their remaining fixtures, I'm now convinced victory is absolutely vital.You see, Boro still have to play Chelsea, Liverpool, Manchester City and Arsenal.Seven points adrift of safety and without a win since Christmas, things are looking desperate, but a home game against Burnley might just provide a much-needed chink of light.The Clarets' away record is easily the worst in the Premier League.On paper, it's the perfect chance for Boro to inject fresh hope into their survival bid. Fail to grab it and the fat lady can start warming up in the wings(c)

programme.title: Stoke City v Liverpool
programme.desc: It's hard to know who to make favourites.Stoke? Much stronger at home, and unburdened by immediate relegation pressure.BUT…..three defeats in a row and one win from six is troubling form. They're not (mathematically) safe yet and perhaps need to engineer a sense of tension.Liverpool? Five games unbeaten and one defeat in seven - plus the other three teams in the top four have all won at Stoke this season.BUT….all five league defeats have come against sides currently in the bottom half, and their recent away form borders on rotten.Those still going for an away win might pair it with Definitly Red for the Grand National. Me? I'm sticking a pin in for both(c)

Five games unbeaten and one defeat in seven - plus the other three teams in the top four have all won at Stoke this season.BUT….all five league defeats have come against sides currently in the bottom half, and their recent away form borders on rotten.Those still going for an away win might pair it with Definitly Red for the Grand National. Me? I'm sticking a pin in for both(c)

programme.title: West Ham United v Swansea City
programme.desc: If West Ham lose this they will be deep in trouble, while Swansea's cave in against Tottenham means another defeat could open a chasm between them and safety.Slaven Bilic has the backing of the owners for now but he must get four points from this and the Sunderland away game next week. After that, Everton, Tottenham and Liverpool lurk in the run-in.Five defeats in a row and no wins in seven makes grim reading for the Hammers.Four consecutive away defeats is concerning for the Swans but for a long while they were decent against Spurs. They could catch West Ham on another nervy day at the new stadium(c)

programme.title: Liverpool v AFC Bournemouth
programme.desc: Sadio Mane's injury has come at a horrible time for Liverpool. He's been involved in 18 league goals this season - his most productive in England by far.Jurgen Klopp has admitted he has no direct one-for-one replacement.The likely return of Daniel Sturridge is timely but with Adam Lallana and Jordan Henderson also out, their squad looks thin for the run-in.It gives Bournemouth a chance. They still need two more wins. They're as likely to get a victory here as they were in the home meeting when Liverpool's attacking brilliance was betrayed by defensive buffoonery.That was an open thriller. This will be tighter.(c)
